file_content.text: No, I won't be defeated. I can't be.
I'm sorry, Thanaton.
Good riddance to him.
He was a better Sith than you give him credit for, Ravage.
Let us hope his successor is as worthy.
My lord, your seat.
Finally, the recognition I deserve. Is there a fancy title to go with it?
It's the least you can do.
My lords, I'm... I'm truly honored. I was not expecting this at all.
Wait... what?
You just killed a Dark Council member in fair combat. What did you expect?
I look forward to working with each and every one of you.
This will be fun.
He is only a lord! You can't put a lord on the Dark Council!
Quiet, Ravage! He's earned his place.
She's only a lord! You can't put a lord on the Dark Council!
Quiet, Ravage! She's earned her place.
By order of the Dark Council and in light of your reputation for serving the Empire, you are now Darth Imperius.
By order of the Dark Council and in light of your reputation as a master of the dark side, you are now Darth Nox.
By order of the Dark Council and in light of your inscrutable reputation, you are now Darth Occlus.
By order of the Dark Council, I proclaim you a Darth, a Dark Lord of the Sith Order.
You are head of the pyramid of ancient knowledge. You are charged with keeping the mystical knowledge of the Sith and guarding the secrets of our order.
With us, you are ruler of all the Sith, answerable only to the Emperor himself.
I will do my best to live up to my new position.
I am truly honored.
Never trust the humble ones.
We'll see how long that lasts.
For now.
I think you will find us more than equal to your threats.
Will I get to meet the Emperor? Why isn't he here?
Where's the Emperor?
The Emperor will summon you, if and when he wishes it.
Our business here is complete. You would do well to meet with your followers on Dromund Kaas and ensure their loyalty.
We will summon you the next time the Dark Council congregates.
My lords, his master was corrupt. He is corrupt. Without Sith tradition, we are nothing!
My lords, her master was corrupt. She is corrupt. Without Sith tradition, we are nothing!
And what are you suggesting we do about it?
You know what the situation requires. Order must be preserved. Punishment meted out.
If we are to conquer our enemies, Zash's former apprentice must die.
He abandoned the arena for the Kaggath when he abandoned Corellia. He is mine to kill.
He's a coward. He dies.
We are well aware of the rules of Kaggath.
I'm flattered you talk about me to all your friends, Darth Thanaton.
You really are obsessed.
Our talk concerns the future of the Sith Order. A future without you.
Then why haven't you killed him yet?
Then why haven't you killed her yet?
You know as well as I do these things require the proper rites.
We people of principles need to stick together.
Why all the animosity?
Principles! What principles are those? Flagrant murder of a master, destruction of Imperial property, mockery of tradition?
Your very existence is an affront to principle, and your refusal to submit to Sith tradition only makes things worse.
If you had lived as long as I have, Thanaton, you would not revere the past so unquestioningly.
The Kaggath is a playground game. Murder has no rules.
The Kaggath is an honored tradition of the Sith. Tulak Hord competed. Marka Ragnos! Ludo Kressh!
The question stands: why has this apprentice, this child, proved impossible for you to kill?
It's simple. I beat him at his own game.
I'm the better Sith.
Don't mock me.
He's had ample opportunity to kill me. He lacks the strength to finish the job.
Thanaton is weak.
I am a member of the Dark Council! I am your superior!
Has it occurred to any of you that I might be just that good?
I'm simply amazing.
A flippant response from a flippant fool.
We are tyrant kings, disseminators of fear. We do not protest, Thanaton; we scheme and then we act.
What is a member of the Dark Council who cannot control his own servants?
I swear, if you don't silence Thanaton, I will!
I will not be betrayed. I will not die. And when I've killed this slave, you will all answer for it.
You have remarkable energy. Who knew the Silencer project could be such a resounding success?
But capital ships are not trivial resources.
Darth Achelon shouldn't have engaged a Republic fleet with one ship.
It was your Sith's mistake.
Perhaps.
You didn't call just to chide me.
Get to your point.
Always suspicious.
If you can't take the loss of a single ally....
Don't be bitter.
That has nothing to do with it.
I wonder why you didn't kill Darth Achelon when you had the chance.
I think the Republic does a good enough job destroying our ships on their own.
We don't need more enemies.
Spoken like a true patriot.
If this is some philosophical trap, I won't be baited.
What's there to wonder?
Fair enough.
If it had been you, I might have chosen differently.
My quarrel isn't with him.
Such discretion.
This ends now. I declare a Kaggath. A contest of mutual annihilation pitting power base against power base.
Whoever sheds the most blood wins. To the victor, eternal glory. To the loser, death and shame.
May the best Sith win.
I accept.
May the best Sith win.
I've never heard of the Kaggath.
The Kaggath?
I keep forgetting how little Zash taught you.
How can you call yourself Sith?
How am I supposed to compete against a Dark Council member?
That hardly seems fair.
Perhaps you should have spent less time alienating potential allies.
You have proven very resourceful thus far.
Corellia is the arena. The Kaggath begins when you land.
Forfeit and be disgraced, hounded to the ends of the galaxy by every Sith in the Empire.
My lord, that was an open channel. Thanaton broadcast the whole thing. He wants everyone watching the Kaggath as it unfolds.
He is well-entrenched on Corellia, but the Empire's fighting a significant battle there. The chaos could be an advantage.
With your permission, I'll transfer to Corellia so that the fleet can provide you support.
I appreciate it.
I won't turn down the help, but I don't require it.
Do as you wish.
Yes, my lord.
What more can you tell me about the Kaggath?
Do you know this ritual?
Ancient Sith duels aren't my specialty, my lord. But I believe it's a battle for prestige as much as anything.
I will try to learn of any weaknesses in Thanaton's power base.
